title: Denial Codes Reference Service
description:
Implement Denial Codes Library (CARC/RARC) with Descriptions and Resolution Recommendations

Create a comprehensive denial codes management system for healthcare claim processing, supporting Claim Adjustment Reason Codes (CARC) and Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARC).

Technical Implementation:
- Database: Create `denial_codes` table with fields: code, code_type (CARC/RARC), category, description, resolution_text, action_items, payer_specific_notes, last_updated
- Data Source: Import official CMS CARC/RARC code sets from X12 standards (maintain versioning for updates)
- API Endpoints:
  - GET /api/denial-codes?type={CARC|RARC}&search={query}
  - GET /api/denial-codes/:code
  - GET /api/denial-codes/recommendations/:code (resolution strategies)
- Search: Full-text search on code, description, and resolution text with fuzzy matching
- Caching: Redis cache for frequently accessed codes (TTL: 24 hours)

Data Structure:
```json
{
  "code": "CO-45",
  "type": "CARC",
  "category": "authorization",
  "description": "Charge exceeds fee schedule/maximum allowable",
  "resolution_steps": ["Verify fee schedule", "Appeal if documented"],
  "typical_turnaround": "30-45 days",
  "appeal_success_rate": 0.65,
  "related_codes": ["RARC-N130"]
}
```

Components:
- DenialCodeSearch: Autocomplete search with category filters
- CodeDetailView: Full code information with expandable resolution guidance
- ResolutionWizard: Step-by-step guided workflow for addressing denials
- BulkCodeLookup: CSV upload for batch code analysis

Business Logic:
- Map denial codes to actionable workflows (appeal, rebill, write-off)
- Track resolution success rates per code for analytics
- Support payer-specific code variations and interpretations

Integration Points:
- Link to claims system for automated denial code assignment
- Export resolution recommendations to claim notes
- Analytics dashboard for denial trends by code

Performance:
- Index on code and code_type for fast lookups
- Preload common codes (top 50) on application startup
- Lazy load resolution details on demand

Security:
- Read-only access for general users
- Admin role required for code library updates
- Audit log for manual code modifications
